hook.text: In France, the national government decides school curricula everywhere. Paris calls all the shots.

buildup.text: Unitary states concentrate authority in the central government. Local bodies carry out orders.

discovery.text: About 160 countries are unitary. Japan, China, and most of Africa use centralized systems.

twist.text: Unitary systems are efficient but can ignore local needs. What works in the capital may fail elsewhere.

climax.text: Many unitary states delegate some power to regions. But the center can always reclaim it.

punchline.text: Unitary states keep it simple: one center, one set of rules.

quiz.question: How many countries use unitary systems?
